conclusion: The working principle of the electromagnetic railgun involves a projectile moving between two parallel rails, propelled by Lorentz force due to rail current and magnetic field.
Xiao Ming purchased a railgun model with specific parameters: rail length 0.5 m, rail spacing 0.02 m, projectile mass 0.02 kg, rail current 10 A, and magnetic field strength 1 T.
All resistances are neglected in the problem.
The task is to find the power of the electromagnetic railgun when the projectile is launched.
Calculate the force exerted on the projectile using the Lorentz force law: F = B I d.
Substitute values into the Lorentz force equation: F = 1 T * 10 A * 0.02 m = 0.2 N.
Determine the acceleration of the projectile using Newton's second law: a = F/m.
Substitute values into the acceleration equation: a = 0.2 N / 0.02 kg = 10 m/s^2.
Find the velocity of the projectile after it is launched using the equation v^2 = v_0^2 + 2aL.
Substitute values into the velocity equation: v = sqrt(2 * 10 m/s^2 * 0.5 m) = sqrt(10) m/s ≈ 3.16 m/s.
Calculate the power required to launch the projectile using the equation P = Fv.
Substitute values into the power equation: P = 0.2 N * 3.16 m/s ≈ 0.632 W.
The power of the electromagnetic railgun when the projectile is launched is approximately 0.632 W.
